title: What is your YouTube channel & why should I subscribe to it? - Quora

response.answer_text: What is your YouTube channel?Growth Origin Why should I subscribe to it?I made only 1 animated video a year or two ago on the boring subject of “RSS Feeds.” I did this because I needed a good explanation video for one of my web pages. But unfortunately for me, there wasn't any good videos anywhere. So I said “screw it” and made one myself.And since the other videos I saw were rather boring, I did my best to make it as interesting as possible for everyone—and I think I succeeded. It was my first video and it took 60 hours to make, despite being only 4-minutes long. As of today (2–19–2019) I’ve gotten over 10,000 views and 100 subscribers (A 1% subscriber rate is really good btw!). And I’m always the first video to show up on Youtube for nearly all of the most common search phrases related to my video subject. I’ve since gotten way better at making videos and I have one completed video ready to upload, and right now I’m currently working on it’s twin video. In fact I just did 4 hours of work on it today. Since both of these two videos are interconnected & related and I plan to upload them both together with each video advertising the other at the end of it. In addition to these videos I’m currently working on I also have 2–3 finished scripts, and distinct plans for about 20 future videos. I have showed about 7 people who weren't family or friends sneak peaks of my future content. And they all gave very genuine and powerful compliments—even people I know to be extreme critics. In fact, not a single person had anything negative to say and all but one who doesn't have a Youtube account subscribed instantly. If you don’t believe me, just look at the comments on my first video; RSS Made Easy. All those super kind comments are from complete strangers I’ve never met. (Well; one is from my mom!) So I’m going to do my best to consistently upload these videos and improve my drawing abilities and I want you to be with me on that journey.In a few years I want you to be able to say, “I was one of the first 150 subscribers to Growth Origin” - Waldo

Well, my YouTube channel is rather unique, because mine is probably the first channel that started out with Gaming videos and later traversed to Gun sync videos 😊 This transformation was when I decided to take a leap of faith and post my first gun sync video of Alan Walker's Faded…It was a good step and I happened to garner more views than what a normal gaming video would. However, there were quite a lot of suggestions for improvement, and I decided to incorporate them in the next few videos. After incorporating these suggestions, I re-uploaded the gun sync version of Alan Walker's Faded and it was the first video that crossed 500 views. There was no looking back from there onwards! Later I decided to do gun syncs of famous indian songs. It was challenging and at the same time rewarding as well! Here's my best effort so far! 😊 Ae Dil Hai Mushkil - Gun Sync First Time Ever! Please do check it out and do let me know your feedback in the comments section 😊

I have two youtube channels; one focused on travel, beer, & whisky. However, it isn’t current nor am I putting up regular content so you may not want to subscribe to it. leswaller My second channel that I am active in is a gaming channel and my focus is bringing laughter and fun to those who watch and play with me. Here again, it may or may not be something you are interested in. If you are a content creator then you probably don’t have time for it and I totally understand. wallerdog

My YouTube channel is called Chocolate Gaming. Due to how small my channel is, and how many channels have to do with Chocolate Gaming, you probably wouldn’t be able to find my channel unless you are specifically looking for it. I make gaming videos, but I haven’t found anything in partiucular that I wanted to record recently. If you know any good games, feel free to let me know. As to why you should subscribe, if you enjoy any of the games that I’ve played on my channel, you might want to subscribe, so you can influence what games I play in the future.

My YouTube channel consists of intense and complex stories with action the use of stop motion animation with lego.
